verses.roman:
ei antya-līlā-sāra, sūtra-madhye vistāra,
kari' kichu kariluṅ varṇana
ihā-madhye mari yabe, varṇite nā pāri tabe,
ei līlā bhakta-gaṇa-dhana

synonyms: ei antya-līlā-sāra—the essence of the antya-līlā (Lord Caitanya's pastimes at the end); sūtra-madhye—in the form of a synopsis; vistāra—expansion; kari'-doing; kichu—something; kariluṅ varṇana—have described; ihā-madhye—in the meantime; mari—I die; yabe—when; varṇite—to describe; nā pāri—not able; tabe—then; ei līlā—these pastimes; bhakta-gaṇa-dhana—the treasure of the devotees.
translation: In this chapter I have to some extent described the essence of the pastimes of Lord Caitanya at the end. If I die in the meantime and cannot describe them in detail, at least the devotees will have this transcendental treasure.
